department.dept_long_name: Department of Organismic and Evolutionary Biology

course.title: Animal Behavior
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., at 10; Guest lectures and film screenings W., at 7:30 pm; one hour discussion section weekly.
course.faculty_text: Naomi E. Pierce and Bence P. Olveczky
course.description: A review of the behavior of animals under natural conditions, with emphasis on both mechanistic and evolutionary approaches. Topics include classical ethology; behavioral endocrinology; behavioral genetics; learning and memory; communication; orientation, migration and biological rhythms; optimal foraging; evolutionary stable strategies; sexual selection; parental investment and mating systems; selfishness, altruism, and reciprocity; and sociality in vertebrates and invertebrates.
